009package imagingbook.common.util;
010
011import java.io.File;
012import java.io.IOException;
013import java.lang.reflect.Field;
014import java.net.URI;
015import java.net.URISyntaxException;
016import java.net.URL;
017import java.nio.file.FileSystems;
018import java.nio.file.Files;
019import java.nio.file.Path;
020import java.nio.file.Paths;
021import java.util.ArrayList;
022import java.util.Collections;
023import java.util.List;
024import java.util.Objects;
025import java.util.stream.Stream;
026
027import imagingbook.core.FileUtils;
028
029/**
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/11/20
033 *
034 */
035public abstract class ClassUtils {
036        
037        private ClassUtils() {}
038        
039        /**
040         * Lists all accessible public fields of the given object and 
041         * returns the result as a string.
042         * @param obj a (non-null) object 
043         * @return a string listing the names and values of the object's fields
044         */
045        public static String listFields(Object obj) {
046                Class<?> clz = obj.getClass();
047                StringBuilder buf = new StringBuilder(clz.getName() + ":\n");
048                Field[] fields = clz.getFields();
049                for (Field f : fields) {
050                        String name = f.getName();
051                        String value = null;
052                        try {
053                                value = f.get(obj).toString();
054                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e1) {                        }
055                        buf.append(name + ": " + value + "\n");
056                }
057                return buf.toString();
058        }
059        
060        /**
061         * Collects and returns the list of classes defined in the specified package.
062         * The {@link Package} may be obtained from an existing {@link Class} object ({@code clazz}) by
063         * {@code clazz.getPackage()}.
064         * 
065         * @param pkg a {@link Package} instance, e.g., {@code Package.getPackage("imagingbook.lib.ij.overlay")}
066         * @return a list of classes contained in the package
067         */
068        public static List<Class<?>> getClassesInPackage(Package pkg) {
069                return getClassesInPackage(pkg.getName());
070        }
071
072        /**
073         * Collects and returns the list of classes defined in the specified package.
074         * Adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/a/58773271 
075         * 
076         * @param pkgName the full package name, e.g., "imagingbook.lib.ij.overlay"
077         * @return a list of classes contained in the package
078         */
079        public static List<Class<?>> getClassesInPackage(final String pkgName) {
080                System.out.println("pkgName = " + pkgName);
081                final String pkgPath = pkgName.replace('.', '/');
082                System.out.println("pkgPath = " + pkgPath);
083                
084                URL pkgURL = ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader().getResource(pkgPath);
085                System.out.println("URL = " + pkgURL);
086                
087                URI pkgURI = null;
088                try {
089                        pkgURI = Objects.requireNonNull(pkgURL.toURI());
090                } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
091                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());
092                }
093                System.out.println("URI = " + pkgURI);
094        
095                Path root = null;
096                if (pkgURI.toString().startsWith("jar:")) {
097                        root = FileSystems.getFileSystem(pkgURI).getPath(pkgPath);
098                        if (root == null) {
099                                try {
100                                        root = FileSystems.newFileSystem(pkgURI, Collections.emptyMap()).getPath(pkgPath);
101                                } catch (IOException e) {
102                                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());
103                                }
104                        }
105                } else {
106                        root = Paths.get(pkgURI);
107                }
108        
109                final ArrayList<Class<?>> allClasses = new ArrayList<Class<?>>();
110                try (final Stream<Path> allPaths = Files.walk(root)) {
111                        allPaths.filter(Files::isRegularFile).forEach(path -> {
112                                String pathName = path.toString();
113                                //System.out.println("pathName = " + pathName);
114                                if (FileUtils.getFileExtension(pathName).equals("class")) {
115                                        String className = FileUtils.stripFileExtension(pathName);
116                                        System.out.println("className = " + className);
117                                        className = className.replace(File.separatorChar, '.');
118                                        className = className.substring(className.indexOf(pkgName));
119                                        try {           
120                                                allClasses.add(Class.forName(className));
121                                        } catch (final ClassNotFoundException | StringIndexOutOfBoundsException ignored) {
122                                        }
123                                }
124                        });
125                } catch (IOException e) {
126                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());
127                }
128                return allClasses;
129        }
130
131}
